abstract: Google’s YouTube service loses money on amateur videos on which it can’t place ads, so one analyst argues that the company should charge people to upload their home movies.
snippet: Google’s YouTube service loses money on amateur videos on which it can’t place ads, so one analyst argues that the company should charge people to upload their home movies.
lead_paragraph: Gene Munster, the analyst with Piper Jaffray, put a report out Thursday looking at the finances of YouTube, and he makes a suggestion that I haven’t seen before: Google should charge a “nominal fee” to people to upload videos to YouTube if the video isn’t appropriate for advertising.

headline.main: Should YouTube Charge a Fee to Upload Video?

abstract: Google has taken Voice out of its private beta-testing stage, and the company is continuing to refine the service.
snippet: Google has taken Voice out of its private beta-testing stage, and the company is continuing to refine the service.
lead_paragraph: It's no secret that I'm a huge fan of Google Voice. To refresh your memory, I quote myself:

headline.kicker: From the Desk of David Pogue

abstract: Google’s net income rose 18 percent in the quarter, suggesting spending on search advertising had stabilized.
snippet: Google’s net income rose 18 percent in the quarter, suggesting spending on search advertising had stabilized.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  Google’s second-quarter financial results suggest that, after months of steep declines, the online advertising market appears to be stabilizing. But anyone scrutinizing Google’s earnings for signs that a recovery is afoot in advertising or the economy at large was likely to be disappointed.

headline.print_headline: As Ad Revenue Stabilizes, Google Earnings Rise 18%
